com.algebraweb.editor.shared.node
Class ContentNode

java.lang.Object
  com.algebraweb.editor.shared.node.ContentNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.IsSerializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NodeContent, PlanNode
public abstract class ContentNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.IsSerializable

A ContentNode is, contrary to a NodeContent, a Node that can hold NodeContents.

Author:
patrick

getDirectNodeContentByScheme

public java.util.List<NodeContent> getDirectNodeContentByScheme(GoAble g)
Returns contents in this ContentNode that fit a given scheme. Stays flat, doet NOT go into content childs!

Parameters:
g - the scheme to look for
Returns:
a list of NodeContents fitting the scheme

getInternalName

public abstract java.lang.String getInternalName()
Return the internal name of this content node. This is usually the XML object's name.

Returns:
the internal name

getLabel

public abstract java.lang.String getLabel()
Returns the label of this content node. This is the label built from the information given in the node scheme file.

Returns:
the assembled label

removeContent

public boolean removeContent(NodeContent con)
Removes a NodeContent object from this content node or from any of its childs (does not stay flat).

Parameters:
con - the NodeContent object to remove
Returns:
true if the deletion was successfull
